required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Entecavir Plus Tenofovir Combination Therapy Versus Entecavir Monotherapy in Naive Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis B
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparative Study of Chronic Hepatitis B Subjects Treated With Entecavir Plus Tenofovir Combination Therapy vs. Entecavir Monotherapy in Adults Who Are Treatment-Naive to Nucleosides and Nucleotides: The BE-LOW Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the effectiveness of entecavir plus tenofovir combination therapy with that of entecavir monotherapy. Safety will also be studied.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Hepatitis B Virus DNA (HBV DNA) Levels <50 IU/mL by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) at Week 96
primary_outcome.description: HBV DNA levels <50 IU/mL=approximately 300 copies/mL. Analyses of binary efficacy endpoint during on-treatment period focused on participants who received treatment and used the analysis of noncompleter=failure (NC=F). All participants who received treatment were included in the denominator, and participants with missing measurements were counted as nonresponders for the specific endpoints.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved HBV DNA Levels <50 IU/mL by PCR at Week 48 and Week 96 by Hepatitis B e Antigen (HBeAg) Status
secondary_outcome.description: HBV DNA levels <50 IU/mL=approximately 300 copies/mL. Analyses of binary efficacy endpoint during on-treatment period focused on participants who received treatment and used the analysis of noncompleter=failure (NC=F). All participants who received treatment were included in the denominator, and participants with missing measurements were counted as nonresponders for the specific endpoints.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved HBV DNA Levels <LOQ by PCR at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: LOQ=lower limit of quantitation. LOQ=29 IU/mL, or approximately 169 copies/mL. LOQ is the level above which quantitative results may be obtained with a specified degree of confidence. The LOQ is mathematically defined as equal to 10 times the standard deviation of the results for a series of replicates used to determine a justifiable limit of detection. Limits of quantitation are matrix-, method-, and analyte-specific.Analyses of binary efficacy endpoint during on-treatment period focused on participants who received treatment and used the analysis of noncompleter=failure (NC=F). All participants who received treatment were included in the denominator, and participants with missing measurements were counted as nonresponders for the specific endpoints.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved HBV DNA Levels <LOD by PCR at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: LOD=Lower limit of detection. LOD) LOD=10 IU/mL, or approximately 58 copies/mL. LOD is the lowest concentration level that can be determined to be statistically different from a blank (99% confidence). The LOD is typically determined to be in the region where the signal to noise ratio is greater than 5. Limits of detection are matrix-, method-, and analyte-specific.Analyses of binary efficacy endpoint during on-treatment period focused on participants who received treatment and used the analysis of noncompleter=failure (NC=F). All participants who received treatment were included in the denominator, and participants with missing measurements were counted as nonresponders for the specific endpoints.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Log 10 HBV DNA at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: HBV DNA was analyzed by PCR, using the Roche COBAS®TaqMan - HPS assay. Reduction in Log 10 HBV count=reduced viral load.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Normalization at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: ALT normalization= ≤1*upper limit of normal (ULN). Analyses of binary efficacy endpoint during on-treatment period focused on participants who received treatment and used the analysis of noncompleter=failure (NC=F). All participants who received treatment were included in the denominator, and participants with missing measurements were counted as nonresponders for the specific endpoints.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis B e Antigen (HBeAg) Loss at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: HBeAg is a hepatitis B viral protein and is an indicator of active viral replication. Analyses of binary efficacy endpoint during on-treatment period focused on participants who received treatment and used the analysis of noncompleter=failure (NC=F). All participants who received treatment were included in the denominator, and participants with missing measurements were counted as nonresponders for the specific endpoints.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HBeAg Seroconversion [( at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: HBeAg seroconversion=HBeAg loss and presence of hepatitis B e antibody (HBeAb). HBeAg is a hepatitis B viral protein and is an indicator of active viral replication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis B Surface Antigen (HBsAg) Loss at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: HBsAg = A part of the hepatitis B virus. When found in the blood, HBsAg is an early marker of infection. Analyses of binary efficacy endpoint during on-treatment period focused on participants who received treatment and used the analysis of noncompleter=failure (NC=F). All participants who received treatment were included in the denominator, and participants with missing measurements were counted as nonresponders for the specific endpoints.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HBsAg Seroconversion at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: HBsAg = a part of the hepatitis B virus that, when in the blood, is an early marker of infection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With HBV DNA in Relevant Categories at Weeks 48 and 96
secondary_outcome.description: Using the Roche COBAS TaqMan - HPS assay. Lower limit of Quantitation (LOQ) is the level above which quantitative results may be obtained with a specified degree of confidence. The LOQ is mathematically defined as equal to 10 times the standard deviation of the results for a series of replicates used to determine a justifiable limit of detection. Limits of quantitation are matrix-, method-, and analyte-specific.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events, Serious Adverse Events, and Discontinuations From Study Drug Due to Adverse Events or Laboratory Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: AE: any new untoward medical occurrence/worsening of pre-existing medical condition, whether or not related to study drug. SAE: any AE that resulted in death; was life threatening; resulted in persistent/significant disability/incapacity; resulted in/prolonged an existing in-patient hospitalization; was a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or was an overdose. Participants who discontinued the study due to any AEs were recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With HBV Resistance Through Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: ETVr=entecavir resistance; TDFr=tenofovir resistance. HBV polymerase using the Trugene® HBV Genotyping Kit. HBV resistance: genotyping of HBV polymerase will be performed on stored viral samples at any timepoint when considered appropriate based on virologic response, including any specimen with detectable HBV DNA. When appropriate, phenotyping will also be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With HBV Resistance at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: ETVr=entecavir resistance; TFDr=tenofovir resistance. HBV polymerase using the Trugene® HBV Genotyping Kit. HBV resistance: genotyping of HBV polymerase will be performed on stored viral samples at any timepoint when considered appropriate based on virologic response, including any specimen with detectable HBV DNA. When appropriate, phenotyping will also be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Virologic Breakthrough at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: ETVr=entecavir resistance; TFDr=tenofovir resistance. Virologic breakthrough= confirmed >= 1 log10 increase in HBV DNA from the on-treatment nadir

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Virologic Breakthrough at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: ETVr=entecavir resistance; TFDr=tenofovir resistance. Virologic breakthrough=confirmed >=1 log10 increase in HBV DNA from moving nadir

intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, ETV = 0.5 mg, once daily, 100 weeks
Tablets, Oral, ETV = 0.5 mg + TFV = 300 mg, once daily, 100 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection (hepatitis B e antigen [HbeAg]-positive or negative) disease
- Nucleoside- and nucleotide-naive
- Males or females ≥16 years of age (or minimum age of consent in a given country)
- Compensated liver function
- HBV DNA >1.72*10*5*IU/mL (approximately 10*6*copies/mL) for HbeAg-positive participants
- HBV DNA >1.72*10*4*IU/mL (approximately 10*5*copies/mL) for Hbe-Ag-negative participants
- Alanine aminotransferase level ≥*upper limit of normal (ULN) and ≤10*ULN
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of decompensated cirrhosis
- Coinfection with human immunodeficiency virus, hepatitis C virus, or hepatitis D virus
- Laboratory values out of protocol-specified range

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 669 participants were enrolled; 384 were randomized. Among 285 who were not randomized, 266 did not meet the study criteria, 11 other, 1 poor compliance/noncompliance, 4 lost to follow-up, 1 withdrew consent, and 2 for administrative reasons.

group.title: ETV 0.5 mg
group.description: Entecavir (ETV) 0.5 mg monotherapy given once daily (QD) for 100 weeks

group.title: ETV 0.5 mg +TDF 300 mg
group.description: ETV 0.5 mg plus Tenofovir (TDF) 300 mg combination therapy given QD for 100 weeks

participants_list.participants: Number of participants randomized and treated; 4 more were randomized but not treated.
Number of participants randomized and treated; 1 more was randomized but not treated.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Hepatitis B Virus DNA (HBV DNA) Levels <50 IU/mL by Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) at Week 96
outcome.description: HBV DNA levels <50 IU/mL=approximately 300 copies/mL. Analyses of binary efficacy endpoint during on-treatment period focused on participants who received treatment and used the analysis of noncompleter=failure (NC=F). All participants who received treatment were included in the denominator, and participants with missing measurements were counted as nonresponders for the specific endpoints.
outcome.population: Evaluable participants. A participant missing the efficacy assessments for a visit is considered a failure and is counted as evaluable.

outcome.description: AE: any new untoward medical occurrence/worsening of pre-existing medical condition, whether or not related to study drug. SAE: any AE that resulted in death; was life threatening; resulted in persistent/significant disability/incapacity; resulted in/prolonged an existing in-patient hospitalization; was a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or was an overdose. Participants who discontinued the study due to any AEs were recorded.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With HBV Resistance Through Week 48
outcome.description: ETVr=entecavir resistance; TDFr=tenofovir resistance. HBV polymerase using the Trugene® HBV Genotyping Kit. HBV resistance: genotyping of HBV polymerase will be performed on stored viral samples at any timepoint when considered appropriate based on virologic response, including any specimen with detectable HBV DNA. When appropriate, phenotyping will also be used.
outcome.population: All participants who received study drug and with HBV DNA levels >=50 IU/mL

outcome.population: Participants with confirmed >=1 log10 increase in HBV DNA from the on-treatment nadir

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication
